iti46:1.1: This was said by the Buddha, the Perfected One: that is what I heard.
iti46:2.1: “Mendicants, live with training as benefit, with wisdom as overseer, with freedom as core, and with mindfulness as ruler.
iti46:2.2: A mendicant who lives in this way can expect one of two results:
iti46:2.3: enlightenment in the present life, or if there’s something left over, non-return.”
iti46:2.4: That is what the Buddha said.
iti46:3.1: “The training fulfilled, not liable to decline,
iti46:3.2: overseen by wisdom, seer of rebirth’s end;
iti46:3.3: that sage bears their final body;
iti46:3.4: they have disposed of Māra, I declare, and gone beyond old age.
iti46:4.1: Therefore be always enjoying absorption, immersed in samādhi,
iti46:4.3: Having overcome Māra and his armies, mendicants,
iti46:5.1: This too was spoken by the Blessed One: that is what I heard.
